response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age/Gender", "high", "A 21‐year-old male is in an age group statistically associated with higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Ethnicity", "medium", "American Indian background may be associated with socio-economic disadvantages that could influence risk, but this is not determinative."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "One arrest with no conviction presents some risk but is not highly indicative by itself."],
    ["Physical Profile", "low", "Height and weight are not significant predictors of recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital/Household Status", "medium", "Being never married and living alone can indicate lower social support, increasing risk moderately."],
    ["Education/Employment", "medium", "Having only a high school diploma, not being in college, and limited job stability (holding only one job in the year) contribute to moderate risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Past marijuana use is noted, which moderately increases risk due to its association with recidivism in some studies."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms on occasion is a moderate risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Family Background", "low", "Living with the biological mother in a household of four suggests normal family structure with minimal risk impact."],
    ["Religious Beliefs", "medium", "A lack of religious engagement may reduce protective social and community support, contributing moderately to risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: A 21‐year-old male is in an age group statistically associated with higher recidivism risk.
American Indian background may be associated with socio-economic disadvantages that could influence risk, but this is not determinative.
One arrest with no conviction presents some risk but is not highly indicative by itself.
Height and weight are not significant predictors of recidivism risk.
Being never married and living alone can indicate lower social support, increasing risk moderately.
Having only a high school diploma, not being in college, and limited job stability (holding only one job in the year) contribute to moderate risk.
Past marijuana use is noted, which moderately increases risk due to its association with recidivism in some studies.
Experiencing depressive symptoms on occasion is a moderate risk factor for recidivism.
Living with the biological mother in a household of four suggests normal family structure with minimal risk impact.
A lack of religious engagement may reduce protective social and community support, contributing moderately to risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as American Indian / Eskimo / Aleut. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
